verses.text: In the third month, when the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they \add into\add* the wilderness of Sinai.
For they were departed from Rephidim, and were come \add to\add* the desert of Sinai, and had pitched in the wilderness; and there Israel camped before the mount.
And Moses went up unto God, and the \sc Lord\sc* called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel;
Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and \add how\add* I bare you on eaglesâ€™ wings, and brought you unto myself.
Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasure unto me above all people: for all the earth \add is\add* mine:
and ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation. These \add are\add* the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.
And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before their faces all these words which the \sc Lord\sc* commanded him.
And all the people answered together, and said, All that the \sc Lord\sc* hath spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people unto the \sc Lord\sc*.

And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify them to day and to morrow, and let them wash their clothes,
and be ready against the third day: for the third day the \sc Lord\sc* will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.

And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, \add that ye\add* go \add not\add* up into the mount, or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:

there shall not a hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether \add it be\add* beast or man, it shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.
And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.
And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day: come not at \add your\add* wives.

And it came to pass on the third day in the morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of the trumpet exceeding loud; so that all the people that \add was\add* in the camp trembled.
And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke, because the \sc Lord\sc* descended upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
And when the voice of the trumpet sounded long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice.
And the \sc Lord\sc* came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the \sc Lord\sc* called Moses \add up\add* to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto the \sc Lord\sc* to gaze, and many of them perish.
And let the priests also, which come near to the \sc Lord\sc*, sanctify themselves, lest the \sc Lord\sc* break forth upon them.
And Moses said unto the \sc Lord\sc*, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou chargedst us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.

And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto him, Away, get thee down, and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto the \sc Lord\sc*, lest he break forth upon them.
So Moses went down unto the people, and spake unto them.
